intro: Acmispon niveus, commonly known as white needlepod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces slender, hairy pods that contain tiny, oval seeds. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Acmispon niveus is an annual herb that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife.
